column4: Hi, I know there's a #vbox channel but nobody's answering. Could someone here maybe help? Host OS: Ubuntu 8.10. Guest OS: Windows XP. My problem: I've tried three times installing now. Every time, it asks for a password in setup, then refuses to accept the password when I try to login after setup is complete. The third time I didn't set a password in setup, I skipped that step, but it still demands a password which doesn't
Sorry to bug you guys when there's a vbox channel but nobody's replying there. Could anybody help me with my vbox?
I've never been asked to set passwords in XP setup, only usernames. Try different install media.
try a different windows installation ISO, such as a MSDN image from microsoft
What do you mean by install media? It asked me for a username (which didn't show up as the username in the login screen - it was just Local Admin) and the password, which it clearly ignored.
Oh sorry, you explained. How would I get that?
THanks.
I'll have a look now.
Sure. Make sure you get one that matches the key you're trying to use.
Oddly, it never asked me for a key.
you have a custom-edited windows ISO
Do I? I believe you.
Could that be the problem then?
You think I have to get a different CD or ISO?
yes, there should be a unattended setup inf file on your CD that contains all the passwords and CDkey
Okay, thanks.
THanks for the help  I'll have a look for that.
Could it also be a problem that I am installing onto an external hard drive?
No, that's no problem, I've done that plenty.

Okay. And I don't have to have any special settings for that, right? Just change the defaults in settings. So this should work after I figure out the unattended thing, okay. I'll give that a try. Thanks again.
Can't change the settings, they're on the ISO file. But you can discover what settings were used.
Thanks again. Better go to bed, I'm flagging, but I'll try it tomorrow. Cheers.
